title: [Medicine] India has “substantially greater” COVID-19 deaths than official reports suggest—close to 3 million, which is more than six times higher than the government has acknowledged and the largest number of any country. The finding could prompt scrutiny of other countries with anomalously low death rates.

[Medicine] An analysis shows that unvaccinated patients with a COVID-19 infection are nearly five times more likely to develop Guillain-Barré Syndrome than COVID-vaccinated patients, with a rate of 28 per million for COVID-vaccinated patients, and 130 per million for unvaccinated, COVID-positive patients
